channel.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client

item.title: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
item.dc:creator: @mista_pnut mista pnut
item.description:
@mista_pnut wrote:

So, I need a way to use absX and absY in my playerHandler class. I’ll show you an example and what the outcome is in the compiler.

if (client.isInLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { count++; }
(Note: I’ve also tried c.absX, c.absY)

The compiler says that it cannot find symbol absX or absY.

PlayerHandler.java:46: cannot find symbol symbol : variable absX location: class PlayerHandler if (client.isInHungerLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ PlayerHandler.java:46: cannot find symbol symbol : variable absY location: class PlayerHandler if (client.isInHungerLobby(absX, absY) && (players[i] != null) && !players[i].disconnected) { ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
item.source: [Delta] absX and absY in another class than client
